Name: DNS Domain Seizure
Description: In this attack pattern, an adversary influences a target's web-hosting company to disable a target domain. The goal is to prevent access to the targeted service provided by that domain. It usually occurs as the result of civil or criminal legal interventions.
Prerequisites: ::This attack pattern requires that the adversary has cooperation from the registrar of the target domain.::
Consequences: ::SCOPE:Availability:TECHNICAL IMPACT:Other:NOTE:Disabling a target domain at the infrastructure level denies the availability of its service to the user.::
Example Instances: ::The FBI's seizure of gambling websites, the US DOJ's seizure of child pornography websites, and Microsoft's seizure of all domains owned by the company No-IP in order to disrupt a cyberattack originating from a subset of those domains.::
